title: Plastic pollution in the marine environment - PMC - National Center for ...
body: Entanglement, toxicological effects via ingestion of plastics, suffocation, starvation, dispersal, and rafting of organisms, provision of new habitats, and introduction of invasive species are significant ecological effects with growing threats to biodiversity and trophic relationships.
readable_content:
- The text provided is about plastic pollution in the marine environment, discussing its impact and various aspects related to it.

<url: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7475234/>

The full text can be accessed using the provided link.
summary: The text provides a comprehensive look at the impact of plastic pollution on the marine environment, discussing its consequences and implications for marine life. It highlights the importance of addressing this issue and the need for effective solutions to mitigate the environmental damage caused by plastic pollution. The sentiment is a concern for the detrimental effects of plastic pollution. Sentiment: 0.8
